What is the title of the e-text?
all_questions.context: ZETETIC ASTRONOMY.

all_questions.question: What is Zetetic Astronomy?
all_questions.context: The term “zetetic” is derived from the Greek verb zeteo; which means to search or examine—to proceed only by inquiry.

all_questions.question: What is wrong with speculative men in philosophy?
all_questions.context: Speculative men, by the force of genius may invent systems that will perhaps be greatly admired for a time; these, however, are phantoms which the force of truth will sooner or later dispel...

all_questions.question: What is the main criticism made by Copernicus about hypotheses in astronomy?
all_questions.context: Neither let any one, so far as hypotheses are concerned, expect anything certain from astronomy; since that science can afford nothing of the kind; lest, in case he should adopt for truth things feigned for another purpose, he should leave this study more foolish than he came.

all_questions.question: What method does Copernicus propose as a way to approach philosophy and theorizing?
all_questions.context: unless the practice of theorising be given up, and the method of simple inquiry, the “zetetic” process be adopted.

all_questions.question: What is zetetic reasoning?
all_questions.context: “Nature speaks to us in a peculiar language; in the language of phenomena, she answers at all times the questions which are put to her; and such questions are experiments.”[2] Not experiments only which corroborate what has previously been assumed to be true; but experiments in every form bearing on the subject of inquiry, before a conclusion is drawn or premises affirmed.

all_questions.question: What is the purpose of the zetetic process in philosophy?
all_questions.context: Let the practice of theorising be cast aside as one fatal to the full development of truth; oppressive to the reasoning power; and in every sense inimical to the progress and permanent improvement of the human race.

all_questions.question: Is the practice of theorizing inimical to progress and permanent improvement of the human race?
all_questions.context: the practice of theorising be cast aside as one fatal to the full development of truth; oppressive to the reasoning power; and in every sense inimical to the progress and permanent improvement of the human race.

all_questions.question: What shape does the surface of the sea appear to be when surrounded by water?

all_questions.question: What shape does the Earth appear to be when viewed from a balloon at its greatest elevation?
all_questions.context: The horizon always appears to be on a level with our eye, and seems to rise as we rise, until at length the elevation of the circular boundary line of the sight becomes so marked that the Earth assumes the anomalous appearance as we have said of a concave rather than a convex body.

all_questions.question: Why does the horizon appear to rise and fall with the observer?
all_questions.context: Ascending or descending, the distant horizon does the same. It rises and falls with the[17] observer, and is always on a level with his eye.

all_questions.question: What appears to happen to the Earth's surface when viewed from a balloon at high elevation?
all_questions.context: The surface of the earth C D appears to rise to the line-of-sight from the balloon, and "seems to close with the sky" at the points H H in the same manner that the ceiling and the floor of a long room, or the top and bottom of a tunnel appear to approach each other, and from the same cause, viz.: that they are parallel to the line-of-sight, and therefore horizontal.

all_questions.question: What would happen if the Earth's surface were convex when viewed from a balloon?
all_questions.context: If the Earth’s surface were convex the observer, looking from a balloon, instead of seeing it gradually ascend to the level of the eye, would[20] have to look downwards to the horizon H H, as represented in figure 9, and the amount of dip in the line-of-sight C H would be the greatest at the highest elevation.

all_questions.question: What is the calculated circumference of the Earth based on 360 degrees?

all_questions.question: What does the observation from a surveyor's experiment imply about the nature of the line of sight from the spirit-level or theodolite?
all_questions.context: If a spirit-level or theodolite be “levelled,” and a given point be read upon a graduated staff at the distance of about or more than 100 chains, this point will have an altitude slightly in excess of the altitude of the cross-hair of the theodolite; and if the theodolite be removed to the position of the graduated staff and again levelled, and a backward sight taken to the distance of 100 chains, another excess of altitude will be observed

all_questions.question: What is the implication of the observation that the line of horizon from a theodolite placed on the sea-shore is always below the cross-hair of the instrument?
all_questions.context: If a theodolite or spirit-level be placed upon the sea-shore, and “levelled,” and directed towards the sea, the line of the horizon will be observed to be a given amount below the cross-hair of the instrument, to which a certain dip, or inclination from the level will have to be given to bring the cross-hair and the sea horizon together.

all_questions.question: What type of experiment can show that the effects observed do not arise from rotundity in the Earth’s surface?

all_questions.question: What is the reason for the 'spherical excess' observed in surveyors?
